attributes.action: Change the protocol in the House of Commons that states no member is allowed to suggest that another is lieing on the grounds that in modern politcs lies are told
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I believe that with stated reasonable grounds it should be allowed for an MP to suggest that another MP is lieing in the House of Commons.
This is motivated by the fact that it has been exposed by a number of incidents (most recent being the foreign criminal scandal at the Home Office)that MPs and ministers may not have been entirely truthful - it is thus clearly outdated not to be able to say you believe someone to be lieing, when in modern politics this may be the case.
The change of this legislation would bring a greater sense of accountability and believability back inot politcs - the lack of these may partly explain the recent rise of political apathy and distrust.
